result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith E. Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Offender-Fail/Update Information, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(4)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Keith E. Williams

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with anyone under the age of 18, any prior victim or their family, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Register as a Sex Offender and comply w/ all requrements of the WI Sex Offender Registry.

superMiscConds.notes: Civil Judgment done for all costs.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Sex Offender Treatment.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.

Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

11:02 AM  State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber. Defendant Keith E. Williams in court in custody with Attorney James J. Ermert.  Clerk: HN.  Sentencing arguments made.  DE is sentenced to 3 years in the WSP.  1 year Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision, with conditions. Consecutive to anything else.  Credit for 225 days.  DE is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and DE is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  Appeal Rights given.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Due to a jury trial in Br 8, the SEHR on 5/18/22 shall be rescheduled.  Clerk sent email to Atty with dates.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Ermert requests an adjournment of the SEHR as he was just appointed and has a calendar conflict. Court approves request. SEHR rescheduled to 5/18/22 at 10:00 am. Attorney Ermert and DA notified by email.
Atty James Ermert
Atty James Ermert
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Brett Ekes.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.    Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 2 years with conditions Consecutive to any other sentence.    Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Court costs & surcharge to be paid during supervision and any unpaid financial obligations that remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Brett Ekes.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Amended List and  Demand for Discovery
Submitted by ADA Thomas Binger
And demand for discovery - filed by ADA T Binger.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared via videoconference from Columbia Correctional, with Atty Brett Ekes in court.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case is not resolved.  Speedy trial demanded.  Jury status hearing 5/12/16 at 1:00.  Jury trial on Friday, 5/13/16, at 8:30.  Bond continued.
Request for Prompt Disposition - DOC Form DOC-197 - received from def.

15CF256 and 15CF932 - Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Atty Brett Ekes appeared for def., who is in Co. Jail on a writ from Columbia Correctional Institution and refuses to leave his cell to come to court.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Ekes waiting for additional discovery.  Status conf. adj. to 2/17/16 at 9:20; def. to appear via videoconference.  Bond continued.

15CF256 & 15CF932 - Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody on a writ from Dodge Correctional) with Atty Brett Ekes.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Ekes was recently appointed to represent def. and has not received discovery in 15CF932.  Atty Ekes requests time to review files and discuss cases with the def.  Status conf. 1/6/16 at 10:20.  Bonds continued.
Atty Brett Ekes
Notice sent to PD's Office for re-appointment.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hans Koesser.  Clerk: PT
Atty Koesser moves to withdraw as counsel as DE refused to meet with him in the jail.  DE states he does not want Atty Koesser to represent him.  Upon hearing statement made by DE court grants Atty Koesser's motion to withdraw and informs DE this will be his final appointment of a new attorney and DE acknowledges.  Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Atty Hans Koesser

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Rocco DeFilippis.  Clerk: PT
Atty DeFilippis moves to withdraw at this time.  Upon hearing statements court grants motion to withdraw and Atty DeFilippis will make arrangements to have another public defender appointed.  Status conference scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Attorney Rocco DeFilippis appeared on behalf of Defendant who does not appear.  Clerk: PT
Atty Binger states DE was transfered to Dodge Correctional and requests an adjournment as so no writ has been done for today.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial on September 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Due to a continued jury trial;  FPT rescheduled to 9/10/15 at 9:30 AM pending confirmation from Atty DeFilippis
Scheduling Order

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Rocco DeFilippis. Clerk LE. Judicial notice taken of JOC in 02CF755. DOC SORP worker Jennifer Arndt sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. DeFilippis. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 7-14-15 @ 8:30am. Bond continued.
